fullText: Patrick Stewart brings his considerable star power and stage presence to a handsomely mounted but ultimately conventional revival of Shakespeare's Scottish play.
dtliExcerpt: Patrick Stewart brings his considerable star power and stage presence to a handsomely mounted but ultimately conventional revival of Shakespeare's Scottish play.
bwwExcerpt: Mr. Cumming delivers the verse with lucidity and intelligence, and it is undeniably pleasing to hear the Scottish play performed with an authentic Scottish accent. But his rendering of Macbeth's culminating burst of pure nihilism - the "Tomorrow, and tomorrow, and tomorrow" soliloquy - comes across ...
